title: Authors and Citation
text: Gregory Jefferis. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jefferis G (2024). malecns: Access latest 'Janelia FlyEM' datasets. R package version 0.3.0.9900, https://flyconnectome.github.io/malecns/, https://github.com/flyconnectome/malecns.
code: @Manual{,   title = {malecns: Access to the latest 'Janelia FlyEM' datasets},   author = {Gregory Jefferis},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.3.0.9900,     https://flyconnectome.github.io/malecns/},   url = {https://github.com/flyconnectome/malecns}, }

what: Access to the latest Janelia FlyEM datasets
title: Access to the latest Janelia FlyEM datasets
text: goal malecns provide natverse access whole male central nervous system dataset Janelia FlyEM.

title: Access to the latest Janelia FlyEM datasets
code: install.packages("natmanager") natmanager::check_pat() natmanager::install(pkgs="flyconnectome/malecns")  usethis::edit_r_profile() # paste in this text, appropriately edited, and close the file options(malevnc.clio_email="myuser@gmail.com") # e.g. "jefferisg" options(malevnc.dvid_user="<surname><firstinitial>")  ## Set your Neuprint token # will open your browser # collect token by clicking on your account icon top right and then Account browseURL('https://neuprint-cns.janelia.org') # back in R usethis::edit_r_environ() # paste in this text replacing with your neuprint token # make sure you have a new lined at the end of the file neuprint_token="eyJhbGci..."  # check everything's configured ok dr_malecns()  # get some data pnmeta=mcns_neuprint_meta('/.+_[adl]+PN') table(pnmeta$type) vm6=read_mcns_meshes('VM6_adPN') plot3d(malecns.surf, alpha=.1)

title: Access to the latest Janelia FlyEM datasets
text: malecns presently thin wrapper around malevnc package. due course hope separate generic functionality malevnc package. However, current arrangement means configuration using malecns package handled malevnc package.

title: Access to the latest Janelia FlyEM datasets
text: package points private resources made available male CNS project led FlyEM team Janelia. therefore need appropriate authorisation install package github access data. can install released version malecns GitHub Note must given access github repository GitHub Personal Access Token (PAT) set order install library long remains private. : check follow instructions necessary create. run errors (significant changes github recently), can also try:
code: install.packages("natmanager") natmanager::install(pkgs="flyconnectome/malecns") natmanager::check_pat() usethis::create_github_token()

title: Access to the latest Janelia FlyEM datasets
text: Access neuprint / Clio depends authentication. neuprint, please see https://github.com/natverse/neuprintr#authentication; need set NEUPRINT_TOKEN R environment variable. can display neuprint token logging neuprint website. Clio, prompted authenticate via Google OAuth “dance” web browser. Note Clio neuprint tokens look similar, . neuprint token appears indefinite clio token currently lasts 3 weeks.

title: Access to the latest Janelia FlyEM datasets
text: interaction Clio/DVID annotation systems may need tell R+malecns emails used sign Clio/neuprint. set .Rprofile file.
code: options(malevnc.clio_email="myuser@gmail.com") options(malevnc.dvid_user="<surname><firstinitial>")

title: Access to the latest Janelia FlyEM datasets
text: example shows read meshes, look ids position transform positions FlyWire/FAFB14.
code: library(malecns) ## read meshes for some annotated neurons  gs="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/13e2yboGmSHrkdew0REkqXWrx5PfHrwPbZZArySjIHtA/edit?usp=sharing" mca=googlesheets4::read_sheet(gs) # update bodyids based on XYZ position mca$position=mcns_xyz2bodyid(mca$position)  confirmed_neurondf=subset(mca, !is.na(ontology)) ml=read_mcns_meshes(confirmed_neurondf) plot3d(ml, col=symbol)  library(natverse) library(fafbseg) # transform a point in FlyWire voxel space to malecns voxel space # and put it on the clipbaord ready to paste into neuroglancer clipr::write_clip(xform_brain(cbind(109953, 50450, 1660)*c(4,4,40),    reference = 'malecns',   sample = 'FlyWire')/8)

title: Access to the latest Janelia FlyEM datasets
text: need update malecns install, recommend:
code: natmanager::install(pkgs="flyconnectome/malecns")

text: Situation report malecns package installation

title: Situation report on your malecns package installation — dr_malecns
code: dr_malecns()

what: malecns: Access to the latest 'Janelia FlyEM' datasets — malecns-package
title: malecns: Access to the latest 'Janelia FlyEM' datasets — malecns-package
text: Provides access latest 'Janelia FlyEM' datasets providing thin wrapper around 'malevnc' package.

title: malecns: Access to the latest 'Janelia FlyEM' datasets — malecns-package
text: malecns.dataset used keep track active   dataset. present expert use recommended   change manually.

title: malecns: Access to the latest 'Janelia FlyEM' datasets — malecns-package
text: Philipp Schlegel made bridging   registrations using bigwarp presynapse predictions male   half brain male cns. See   slack   details.

title: malecns: Access to the latest 'Janelia FlyEM' datasets — malecns-package
text: Maintainer: Gregory Jefferis jefferis@gmail.com (ORCID)

title: malecns: Access to the latest 'Janelia FlyEM' datasets — malecns-package
code: # \donttest{ options()[grepl("^malecns", names(options()))] #> $malecns.dataset #> [1] "CNS" #>  # } if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ dr_malecns() } # }  # \donttest{ library(nat.templatebrains) xform_brain(cbind(443344, 225172, 44920), sample = 'FAFB14',   reference = 'malecns') #>          [,1]     [,2]     [,3] #> [1,] 302807.7 215023.5 117948.1  mcflm=system.file("landmarks/maleCNS_brain_FAFB_landmarks_um.csv", package = 'malecns') mcflm=read.csv(mcflm) head(mcflm) #>   X   fafb_x    fafb_y    fafb_z    cns_x     cns_y    cns_z #> 1 0 522.3291 183.04947  95.20722 388.0265 161.15978 167.5336 #> 2 1 454.3915  88.80129  95.36000 316.4307  61.91385 170.2850 #> 3 2 597.4928  98.03833  83.20296 448.9167  60.41804 171.1397 #> 4 3 520.0082 210.97573 125.01538 386.9356 193.88847 208.3717 #> 5 4 414.5413 169.81426 155.26571 274.9307 152.79578 222.6996 #> 6 5 645.5330 176.75863 134.32295 501.8497 141.52257 219.8995 if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(nat.jrcbrains) da1.hb=neuprintr::neuprint_read_neurons('/DA1.*lPN',   conn=neuprintr::neuprint_login(server='https://neuprint.janelia.org',     dataset = 'hemibrain:v1.2.1')) # nb hemibrain neurons comes in 8nm raw voxel coordinates not microns da1.hb.mcns=xform_brain(da1.hb*(8/1000), sample='JRCFIB2018F', reference='malecns') # read in a male cns DA1 neuron da1.1=read_mcns_meshes(11996, units='nm') nclear3d() plot3d(da1.hb.mcns, col='cyan') plot3d(da1.1, col='red') plot3d(malecns.surf, alpha=.1) } # } # }

what: Surface models of the malecns brain (in nm) — malecns_shell.surf
title: Surface models of the malecns brain (in nm) — malecns_shell.surf
text: malecns_shell.surf surface model cortex   (rind) malecns brain (nm). downloaded link provided   Stuart Berg (FlyEM). malecns.surf surface model malecns neuropil   generated Philipp Schlegel May 2022 based location T bars   dataset. See   slack   details. JRCFIB2022M.surf malecns.surf aliases malecnsvnc_shell.surf surface model cortex   (rind) malecns ventral nerve cord (nm). downloaded   link provided Stuart Berg (FlyEM) 2023-11-18.

title: Surface models of the malecns brain (in nm) — malecns_shell.surf
code: malecns_shell.surf  malecns.surf  JRCFIB2022M.surf  malecnsvnc_shell.surf

title: Surface models of the malecns brain (in nm) — malecns_shell.surf

title: Surface models of the malecns brain (in nm) — malecns_shell.surf
code: # \donttest{ library(nat) boundingbox(malecns_shell.surf) #>          [,1]     [,2]     [,3] #> [1,]  16898.1  31849.1  26324.4 #> [2,] 750590.0 441841.0 460357.0 #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "boundingbox" # } if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ plot3d(malecns_shell.surf, alpha=.2, col='grey') # in microns plot3d(malecns_shell.surf/1e3, alpha=.2, col='grey') # in raw voxels plot3d(malecns_shell.surf*(8/1e3), alpha=.2, col='grey') # mesh3d gives more flexibility plot3d(as.mesh3d(malecns_shell.surf), alpha=.2, col='grey', type='wire', add=T) } # } # \donttest{ library(nat) boundingbox(malecns.surf) #>          [,1]     [,2]     [,3] #> [1,]  45319.4  38146.7  79817.4 #> [2,] 726917.9 417784.6 341814.2 #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "boundingbox" # } if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ plot3d(malecns.surf, alpha=.2, col='grey') # in microns plot3d(malecns.surf/1e3, alpha=.2, col='grey') # in raw voxels plot3d(malecns.surf*(8/1e3), alpha=.2, col='grey') # mesh3d gives more flexibility plot3d(as.mesh3d(malecns.surf), alpha=.2, col='grey', type='wire', add=T) } # } # \donttest{ library(nat) boundingbox(malecnsvnc_shell.surf) #>        [,1]   [,2]    [,3] #> [1,] 236909 307526  415488 #> [2,] 551724 574158 1076990 #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "boundingbox" # } if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ nclear3d() plot3d(malecns.surf, col='blue') wire3d(malecns_shell.surf, col='grey') plot3d(malecnsvnc_shell.surf, alpha=.2, col='green') } # }

title: Set Clio body annotations — mcns_annotate_body
text: Set Clio body annotations

title: Set Clio body annotations — mcns_annotate_body
code: mcns_annotate_body(   x,   test = TRUE,   version = NULL,   write_empty_fields = FALSE,   designated_user = NULL,   protect = c("user"),   chunksize = 50,   check_types = TRUE,   ... )

title: Set Clio body annotations — mcns_annotate_body
text: x data.frame, list JSON string containing body annotations. End users strongly recommended use data.frames. test Whether use test clio store (recommended sure know ). version Optional clio version associate annotation. default NULL uses current version returned API. write_empty_fields x data.frame, controls whether empty fields x (.e. NA "") overwrite fields clio-store database (protected protect argument). (conservative) default write_empty_fields=FALSE overwrite. want set fields empty value (usually empty string) must set write_empty_fields=TRUE. designated_user Optional email address one person uploading annotations behalf another user. See Users section details. protect Vector fields overwritten already value clio store. Set TRUE protect fields FALSE overwrite fields provide data. See details rational behind default value "user" chunksize many bodies annotate request default sent 50 records time avoid issue timeouts. can increase small speed find setup fast enough. Set Inf insist records sent single request. NB applies x data.frame. check_types Whether verify types columns. ... Additional parameters passed pbapply::pbsapply

title: Set Clio body annotations — mcns_annotate_body
text: NULL invisibly success. Errors failure.

title: Set Clio body annotations — mcns_annotate_body
text: Details Clio body annotation system provided   basic    docs Bill Katz. body associated JSON list containing   set standard user visible fields. constrained. See   Clio    fields Google sheet details. can take time apply annotations, requests chunked   default groups 50. single column called position 3 columns names x, y, z X, Y,   Z form accepted xyzmatrix converted   position stored record. recommended creating   records. protect=TRUE data Clio overwritten - new   data added. protect=FALSE fields overwritten   new data non-empty value x.   write_empty_fields=TRUE even empty fields x   overwrite fields database. Note conditions apply per   record .e. per neuron per column data.

title: Set Clio body annotations — mcns_annotate_body
text: Validation depends provide input data.   x data.frame row checked basics   including presence bodyid, empty fields removed. future   also check fields allowed take certain values. x character vector, checked see valid   JSON bodyid field record. intended   principally developer use confirm specific JSON payload   applied. probably using regularly bulk   upload. x list, validation occurs. reasons, strongly recommended end users provide   data.frame input.

title: Set Clio body annotations — mcns_annotate_body
text: Clio now records user timestamp every modification   fields record. example edit type field   type_user field filled email address   use authenticate Clio. default email address   used since contained within clio token. can also   specify alternate user designated_user argument. See   manc_annotate_body documentation details.

title: Set Clio body annotations — mcns_annotate_body
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # note use of test server mcns_annotate_body(data.frame(bodyid=10005, group=10005), test=TRUE) } # }

Additional arguments passed pbapply::pblapply

title: Connectivity query for CNS neurons — mcns_connection_table

title: Connectivity query for CNS neurons — mcns_connection_table
text: ids set body ids (see manc_ids range ways specify ). partners Either inputs outputs. Redundant prepost, probably clearer. moredetails Either logical (add fields TRUE) character vector naming additional fields returned mcns_neuprint_meta added results data.frame. summary Whether summarise results per partner giving multiple query neurons threshold return partners >= integer value. Default 1 returns partners. threshold applied ROI weight roi argument specified, otherwise whole neuron. conn Optional, neuprint_connection object, also specifies neuPrint server. Defaults manc_neuprint() ensure query VNC dataset. ... additional arguments passed neuprint_connection_table

title: Connectivity query for CNS neurons — mcns_connection_table
text: data.frame

title: Connectivity query for CNS neurons — mcns_connection_table
code: # \donttest{ joffrey.id=mcns_xyz2bodyid(cbind(24590, 13816, 26102)+4096, node = 'neuprint') #> Error in clio_auth(): Clio/Google auth failure. Do you have access rights to VNC clio? #> Try specifying the email linked to clio in a call to `clio_auth` or setting `options(malevnc.clio_email)`! joffrey.us=mcns_connection_table(joffrey.id, partners = 'in') #> Error in clio_auth(): Clio/Google auth failure. Do you have access rights to VNC clio? #> Try specifying the email linked to clio in a call to `clio_auth` or setting `options(malevnc.clio_email)`! joffrey.uss=mcns_connection_table(joffrey.id, partners = 'in', summary=TRUE) #> Error in clio_auth(): Clio/Google auth failure. Do you have access rights to VNC clio? #> Try specifying the email linked to clio in a call to `clio_auth` or setting `options(malevnc.clio_email)`! # } if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # open top 10 partners in neuroglancer, # NB segmentation / meshes to match neuprint mcns_scene(joffrey.uss$partner[1:10], open = TRUE, node='neuprint') } # }

title: Cosine plot — mcns_cosine_plot
text: Cosine plot

title: Cosine plot — mcns_cosine_plot
code: mcns_cosine_plot(   ids,   partners = c("output", "input"),   group = FALSE,   groupfun = NULL,   labRow = "{name}_{group}",   predict.manc = FALSE,   heatmap = TRUE,   metadata.source = c("neuprint", "clio"),   interactive = FALSE,   action = NULL,   threshold = 10,   ... )

title: Cosine plot — mcns_cosine_plot
text: ids Bodyids form understood mcns_ids partners Whether cluster based connections input output partner neurons (default ). group Optional character vector specifying grouping column partner neurons constructing cosine similarity matrix. TRUE implies 'group'. groupfun function receives metadata partner neurons returns single grouping vector (see details section). labRow string interpolated glue using dataframe metadata fetched mcns_neuprint_meta. Alternatively character vector many elements ids directly specifying rows. predict.manc whether use manc_bodyid predicted matches define grouping information addition curated manc_group matches. See mcns_predict_group details. heatmap logical indicating whether plot heatmap function plot heatmap whose argument names compatible stats::heatmap. gplots::heatmap.2 good example. Defaults TRUE therefore plotting full heatmap stats::heatmap. metadata.source Whether use neuprint (mcns_neuprint_meta) clio () interactive Whether plot interactive heatmap (allowing zooming id selection). See details. action Whether zero drop NA values cosine matrix (may present columns entries) threshold integer threshold (connections >= returned) ... additional arguments passed neuprint_cosine_plot eventually heatmap.

title: Cosine plot — mcns_cosine_plot
text: result heatmap invisibly including row   column dendrograms.

title: Cosine plot — mcns_cosine_plot
code: # \donttest{ # cosine clustering based on grouped output partners (mainly DNs right now) r=mcns_cosine_plot("/name:LAL.+", partners='out', group=TRUE) #> Error in clio_auth(): Clio/Google auth failure. Do you have access rights to VNC clio? #> Try specifying the email linked to clio in a call to `clio_auth` or setting `options(malevnc.clio_email)`! # } if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # fancier labelling of rows including soma side of neurons r=mcns_cosine_plot("/name:LAL.+", partners='out', group=TRUE,   labRow = '{name}_{group}_{mcns_soma_side(data.frame(bodyid, name, somaLocation))}')  r2=mcns_cosine_plot("/name:LAL.+", partners='out', group=TRUE,   labRow = '{instance}_{group}_{soma_side}', metadata.source='clio')  # interactive version (open in browser) mcns_cosine_plot('/name:Pm2.*R', group=T, interactive = T)  # just return an hclust (dendrogram) object without plotting anything pm2.hc=mcns_cosine_plot('/name:Pm2.*R', group=T, heatmap=FALSE) plot(pm2.hc) } # }

Accepted options : 'user', 'time', ''. cache Whether cache result call 5 minutes. ... Additional arguments passed pbapply::pblapply

title: Return all DVID body annotations — mcns_dvid_annotations

title: Login to male CNS neuprint server — mcns_neuprint
text: token Optional neuprint access token (see details examples trouble multiple tokens). Force Whether force new login CATMAID server (default FALSE) ... Additional arguments passed neuprint_login

title: Login to male CNS neuprint server — mcns_neuprint
text: neuprint_connection object returned   neuprint_login

title: Login to male CNS neuprint server — mcns_neuprint
text: possible use token across public   private neuprint servers using email address. However   seem work users. giving , try   using recently issued token private server (e.g. cns   dataset) rather older tokens e.g. hemibrain dataset. need   pass specific token can use token argument, also   setting Force=T ensure specified token used   already tried log current session. See examples   code.

title: Login to male CNS neuprint server — mcns_neuprint
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ cnsc=mcns_neuprint()  # log in using specified token rather than the one in the neuprint_token # environment variable. This should then be cached for the rest of the R # session. cnsc=mcns_neuprint(token="XXX", Force=T)  anchorids <- neuprintr::neuprint_ids("status:Anchor", conn=cnsc) # the last connection will be used by default anchormeta <- neuprintr::neuprint_get_meta("status:Anchor")  plot(cumsum(sort(anchormeta$pre, decreasing = TRUE)), ylab='Cumulative presynapses') plot(cumsum(sort(anchormeta$post, decreasing = TRUE)), ylab='Cumulative postsynapses') } # }

Defaults manc_neuprint() ensure query VNC dataset. roiInfo whether include roiInfo field detailing synapse numbers different locations. omitted default returned character vector unprocessed JSON. simplify.xyz Whether simplify columns containing XYZ locations simple "x,y,z" format rather longer form referencing schema spatialreference.org. Defaults TRUE. ... Additional arguments passed neuprint_get_meta

title: Fetch neuprint metadata for malecns neurons — mcns_neuprint_meta

title: Fetch neuprint metadata for malecns neurons — mcns_neuprint_meta
code: # \donttest{ library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:nat’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, union #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union # fetch metatada for all bodies in neuprint mnm=mcns_neuprint_meta() #> Error in clio_auth(): Clio/Google auth failure. Do you have access rights to VNC clio? #> Try specifying the email linked to clio in a call to `clio_auth` or setting `options(malevnc.clio_email)`! # fetch metadata for all bodies with a somaLocation mnm.soma=mcns_neuprint_meta("where:exists(n.somaLocation)") #> Error in clio_auth(): Clio/Google auth failure. Do you have access rights to VNC clio? #> Try specifying the email linked to clio in a call to `clio_auth` or setting `options(malevnc.clio_email)`!  # type or instance present mnm.ti <- mcns_neuprint_meta('where:exists(n.type) OR exists(n.instance)') #> Error in clio_auth(): Clio/Google auth failure. Do you have access rights to VNC clio? #> Try specifying the email linked to clio in a call to `clio_auth` or setting `options(malevnc.clio_email)`! # }

what: Predict the group of neurons using instance or type information — mcns_predict_group
title: Predict the group of neurons using instance or type information — mcns_predict_group
text: Predict group neurons using instance type information

title: Predict the group of neurons using instance or type information — mcns_predict_group
code: mcns_predict_group(   ids,   method = c("auto", "fullauto", "group", "manc", "instance", "type", "pmanc", "all"),   badtypes = c(NA, "", "Lamina_R1-R6", "Descending", "KC", "ER", "LC", "PB",     "Ascending Interneuron", "Delta", "P1_L candidate", "LT", "MeMe", "PFGs", "Mi", "VT",     "ML", "EL", "FB", "Dm", "DNp", "FC", "OL", "T", "Y") )

title: Predict the group of neurons using instance or type information — mcns_predict_group
text: ids Body ids form understood mcns_ids. metadata dataframe returned mcns_neuprint_meta ideal function called hood. method string specifying 5 methods use identify group. "" means return 5, "fullauto" means look method turn successively filling missing group values. Method "auto" (default) excludes predicted manc matches (see details). badtypes Values type column ignored purposes defining cell type groups. contain bad values types broad useful.

title: Predict the group of neurons using instance or type information — mcns_predict_group
text: method="" dataframe returned   mcns_neuprint_meta additional columns   instance_group type_group. Otherwise numeric vector.

title: Predict the group of neurons using instance or type information — mcns_predict_group
text: Grouping information neurons male cns presently   scattered several locations. include numeric group field,   type field instance field. type field value,   neurons form group. However values known   bad excluded. additional source group information comes matches VNC neurons   MANC dataset. either come curated matches (  manc_group column entered Clio, method="manc")   predicted matches (based manc_bodyid column,   method="pmanc"). method="pmanc" used caution since significant   percentage matches wrong. However, since majority   correct, may still useful source group information e.g.   connectivity clustering typically sensitive errors. Given situation method='auto' (default) uses curated   matches (method="manc"). Select method='fullauto' use   predicted MANC matches fall-back.

title: Predict the group of neurons using instance or type information — mcns_predict_group
code: # \donttest{ library(dplyr) # return all body ids with a group type or instance tig_ids=mcns_ids('where:exists(n.group) OR exists(n.type) OR exists (n.instance)') #> Error in clio_auth(): Clio/Google auth failure. Do you have access rights to VNC clio? #> Try specifying the email linked to clio in a call to `clio_auth` or setting `options(malevnc.clio_email)`! allg=mcns_predict_group(tig_ids, method = 'all') #> Error: object 'tig_ids' not found # neurons where the recorded group and instance group disagree allg %>% filter(!is.na(group) & !is.na(instance_group) & group!=instance_group) #> Error: object 'allg' not found # } if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # neurons where the recorded group and type group disagree type_group_mismatch <- allg %>% filter(!is.na(group) & !is.na(type_group) & group!=type_group) allg %>%   filter(group %in% type_group_mismatch$group | type_group %in% type_group_mismatch$type_group) %>%  select(bodyid, type, name, group, type_group, instance_group) %>%  arrange(type, group) %>% View } # }

title: Predict the cell type of male cns neurons from type and name/instance fields — mcns_predict_type
text: ids Body ids form understandable mcns_ids method prediction method use (type, instance auto, uses type available, instance otherwise). special value adds 3 columns metadata data.frame type_t, type_i, type_a containing results methods. prefer.foreign Whether prefer foreign type (flywire, manc, hemibrain) available. may useful integration across datasets.

title: Predict the cell type of male cns neurons from type and name/instance fields — mcns_predict_type
text: data.frame type='', character vector otherwise.

title: Predict the cell type of male cns neurons from type and name/instance fields — mcns_predict_type
text: time instance form 12345_L   12345 returned type. obviously useful   purposes (use mcns_predict_group want group).

title: Predict the cell type of male cns neurons from type and name/instance fields — mcns_predict_type
code: # \donttest{ mnm.ti <- mcns_neuprint_meta('where:exists(n.type) OR exists(n.instance)') #> Error in clio_auth(): Clio/Google auth failure. Do you have access rights to VNC clio? #> Try specifying the email linked to clio in a call to `clio_auth` or setting `options(malevnc.clio_email)`! # Descending neurons with the wrong class mnm.ti %>%   mutate(ptype=mcns_predict_type(.)) %>%   filter(grepl("DN[abdgpx]", ptype)) %>%   filter(class!='Descending' | is.na(class)) #> Error: object 'mnm.ti' not found  # report all the different types available for these two VPNs mcns_predict_type("LoVP106", method = 'all') |>   select(matches('.ype')) #> Error in clio_auth(): Clio/Google auth failure. Do you have access rights to VNC clio? #> Try specifying the email linked to clio in a call to `clio_auth` or setting `options(malevnc.clio_email)`! # report just one type, preferring malecns type (the default) mcns_predict_type("LoVP106") #> Error in clio_auth(): Clio/Google auth failure. Do you have access rights to VNC clio? #> Try specifying the email linked to clio in a call to `clio_auth` or setting `options(malevnc.clio_email)`! # ... or preferring the foreign type (flywire in this case) mcns_predict_type("LoVP106", prefer.foreign=TRUE) #> Error in clio_auth(): Clio/Google auth failure. Do you have access rights to VNC clio? #> Try specifying the email linked to clio in a call to `clio_auth` or setting `options(malevnc.clio_email)`! # }

title: Set the DVID type, instance or group for some malecns neurons — mcns_set_dvid_annotations
text: ids Body ids type Character vector specifying authoritative cell type e.g. "LHAD1g1" hemibrain. group One LR groups (.e. candidate cell types) apply. normally lowest bodyid group. Must length ids unless length 1. synonyms Character vector specifying cell type e.g. "LHAD1g1" side Character vector specifying side neuron ("L", "R", "M" midline, "" specified). instance Character vector specifying instances (names) neurons (see details) logical value TRUE (default) means append side type. user DVID user. Defaults options("malevnc.dvid_user"). ... Additional arguments passed malevnc::manc_set_dvid_instance thence pbapply::pbmapply multiple body ids.

title: Set the DVID type, instance or group for some malecns neurons — mcns_set_dvid_annotations
text: male CNS, evolving standard seems record   following fields (examples given APL) type='APL' instance='APL_R' group='APL_R' type_user, instance_user, group_user='jefferisg' accompany   . Note type_user, instance_user, group_user set   automatically using user argument. Regrettably   currently specify different users different different fields (e.g. one   user instance different user type).   need (e.g. making annotations behalf users)   need make separate calls   mcns_set_dvid_annotations field need set. delete annotation set e.g. instance="".   careful!.

title: Set the DVID type, instance or group for some malecns neurons — mcns_set_dvid_annotations
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ mcns_set_dvid_annotations(10297, type = 'LHAD1g1') mcns_set_dvid_annotations(10977, type='APL', side='L', group = 10540) # only set the LR group mcns_set_dvid_annotations(ids=c(13115, 14424), group = 13115)  # unset i.e. remove a type (careful!) mcns_set_dvid_annotations(18987, type = "", user = "becketti") } # }

what: Find/predict the soma side or position of male cns neurons. — mcns_soma_side
title: Find/predict the soma side or position of male cns neurons. — mcns_soma_side
text: mcns_somapos returns XYZ location (nm, microns   raw voxel space) soma position neurons. valid soma   position available, NA value returned.

title: Find/predict the soma side or position of male cns neurons. — mcns_soma_side
code: mcns_soma_side(ids, method = c("auto", "position", "instance", "manual"))  mcns_somapos(ids, units = c("nm", "microns", "um", "raw"))

title: Find/predict the soma side or position of male cns neurons. — mcns_soma_side
text: ids set bodyids dataframe containing name somaLocation fields method Whether use side recorded instance field, soma position turn predict. method manual returns manually curated soma sides recorded via Clio (see details). units mcns_somapos units returned 3D positions. Defaults nm.

title: Find/predict the soma side or position of male cns neurons. — mcns_soma_side
text: mcns_soma_side vector sides (L, R, M, U NA).   Midline unpaired neurons indicated M although   seen U past.

title: Find/predict the soma side or position of male cns neurons. — mcns_soma_side
text: recorded somaSide column neuPrint / soma_side   clio preferred always available.   method='auto' prefer columns cascade   instance somaLocation define rest.

title: Find/predict the soma side or position of male cns neurons. — mcns_soma_side
code: # \donttest{ mcns_soma_side('/LAL04.*') #> Error in clio_auth(): Clio/Google auth failure. Do you have access rights to VNC clio? #> Try specifying the email linked to clio in a call to `clio_auth` or setting `options(malevnc.clio_email)`! # } if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # All neurons with a type table(mcns_soma_side('/.*'), useNA='if')  # compare manual with predictions mcnswsoma=mcns_body_annotations(query=list(soma_side="exists/1")) mcnswsoma$pside=mcns_soma_side(mcnswsoma$bodyid) with(mcnswsoma, table(soma_side, pside))  # compare manual with instance mcnswsoma=mcns_body_annotations(query=list(soma_side="exists/1")) mcnswsoma$iside=mcns_soma_side(mcnswsoma$bodyid, method='instance') with(mcnswsoma, table(soma_side, iside, useNA = 'i'))  # converse: compare instance with manual mcns_instance=mcns_neuprint_meta('/name:.+') if(!"somaSide" %in% colnames(mcns_instance))   mcns_instance$somaSide=mcns_soma_side(mcns_instance, method='manual') mcns_instance$iside=mcns_soma_side(mcns_instance, method='instance') # many mismatches e.g. due to neurons without a soma including truncated # sensory neurons, ascending neurons etc with(mcns_instance, table(somaSide, iside, useNA = 'i'))  # we can parse that a bit by doing mcns_instance %>% filter(soma) %>% with(table(somaSide, iside, useNA = 'i')) } # } sp=mcns_somapos('/LAL04.*', units='um') #> Error in clio_auth(): Clio/Google auth failure. Do you have access rights to VNC clio? #> Try specifying the email linked to clio in a call to `clio_auth` or setting `options(malevnc.clio_email)`! plot(sp[,1:2]) #> Error: object 'sp' not found

what: Map XYZ locations to bodyids for the male cns dataset — mcns_xyz2bodyid
title: Map XYZ locations to bodyids for the male cns dataset — mcns_xyz2bodyid
text: Map XYZ locations bodyids male cns dataset

title: Map XYZ locations to bodyids for the male cns dataset — mcns_xyz2bodyid
code: mcns_xyz2bodyid(   xyz,   units = c("raw", "nm", "microns", "um"),   node = "neutu",   cache = FALSE )

title: Map XYZ locations to bodyids for the male cns dataset — mcns_xyz2bodyid
text: xyz xyz    location (default raw malecns pixels) units Optional units incoming 3D positions. Defaults raw. node DVID node returned manc_dvid_node. default return current active (unlocked) node used neutu. cache Whether cache result call 5 minutes.

title: Map XYZ locations to bodyids for the male cns dataset — mcns_xyz2bodyid
text: character vector body ids (0 missing somas / missing   locations)

title: Map XYZ locations to bodyids for the male cns dataset — mcns_xyz2bodyid
code: # \donttest{ # find the bodyids corresponding to set of soma positions mcns_xyz2bodyid(mcns_somapos("/LAL04[12]", units='raw'), units='raw') #> Error in clio_auth(): Clio/Google auth failure. Do you have access rights to VNC clio? #> Try specifying the email linked to clio in a call to `clio_auth` or setting `options(malevnc.clio_email)`! # } # the APL if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ mcns_xyz2bodyid(cbind(24508, 15674, 26116)+4096) } # }

text: Mirror points malecns space

title: Mirror points in malecns space — mirror_malecns
code: mirror_malecns(x, ...)

title: Mirror points in malecns space — mirror_malecns
text: x objects 3D vertices (calibrated nm) ... Additional arguments passed nat.templatebrains::xform_brain

title: Mirror points in malecns space — mirror_malecns
text: transformed object

title: Mirror points in malecns space — mirror_malecns
text: mirroring course improved. used Philipp   Schlegel's 69 landmarks map malecns -> FAFB space followed   nat.jrcbrains::mirror_fafb function map landmarks   opposite side FAFB brought back malecns.

title: Mirror points in malecns space — mirror_malecns
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ f3=system.file("landmarks/maleCNS_mirror_landmarks_nm.csv", package = 'malecns') maleCNS_mirror_landmarks_nm <- read.csv(f3)[-1] points3d(mirror_malecns(maleCNS_mirror_landmarks_nm[1:3])) points3d(maleCNS_mirror_landmarks_nm[1:3], col='green') # almost on top of the black points points3d(maleCNS_mirror_landmarks_nm[4:6]+500, col='red') } # }

what: Read a mesh for the current segmentation — read_mcns_meshes

text: Read mesh current segmentation

title: Read a mesh for the current segmentation — read_mcns_meshes
code: read_mcns_meshes(   ids,   units = c("nm", "raw", "microns"),   type = c("auto", "dvid", "small"),   node = "neutu",   df = NULL,   ... )

title: Read a mesh for the current segmentation — read_mcns_meshes
text: ids set body ids form understandable manc_ids units Units returned neurons (default nm) type One "auto" (default), "dvid" "small" (see details). node DVID node returned manc_dvid_node. default return current active (unlocked) node used neutu. df data.frame containing information neurons meshes fetched. Optional ids data.frame, used. ... Additional arguments passed httr::GET

title: Read a mesh for the current segmentation — read_mcns_meshes
text: neuronlist containing one mesh3d   objects.

title: Read a mesh for the current segmentation — read_mcns_meshes
text: dvid meshes pre-computed automatically deleted   recomputed bodies edited. However process   noticeable lag. small meshes generated demand process   can quite slow. auto try dvid method   switch small fails. See   slack    details; essentially behaviour flyem clio   fork.

title: Read a mesh for the current segmentation — read_mcns_meshes
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ml=read_mcns_meshes(1796013202) plot3d(ml) # or if there's just one mesh, you can get more control with the rgl commands # like wire3d wire3d(ml[[1]]) } # }

title: Read neuronal skeletons via neuprint — read_mcns_neurons
text: ids Bodyids form compatible malevnc::manc_ids connectors Whether fetch synaptic connections neuron (default FALSE contrast neuprint_read_neurons). units Units returned neurons (default nm) heal.threshold threshold ... Additional arguments passed neuprint_read_neurons

title: Read neuronal skeletons via neuprint — read_mcns_neurons
text: neuronlist object containing one   neuron objects.

title: Read neuronal skeletons via neuprint — read_mcns_neurons
code: # nb convert n30102=read_mcns_neurons(30102) #> Error in clio_auth(): Clio/Google auth failure. Do you have access rights to VNC clio? #> Try specifying the email linked to clio in a call to `clio_auth` or setting `options(malevnc.clio_email)`! # neuronlist n30102 #> Error: object 'n30102' not found boundingbox(n30102) #> Error: object 'n30102' not found # neuron n30102[[1]] #> Error: object 'n30102' not found if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ nclear3d() plot3d(malecns.surf, alpha=.1) plot3d(n30102, lwd=2, soma=2000) } # }

what: Evaluate an expression after temporarily setting malevnc options — with_mcns
title: Evaluate an expression after temporarily setting malevnc options — with_mcns
text: malecns thin wrapper around malevnc   operates changing server/dataset options package.   function temporarily changes options, runs required expression   sets back . choose_mcns swaps male vnc dataset male   cns. means functions malevnc package   target male cns instead. recommended use   with_mcns function temporarily unless   intention using male vnc dataset.

title: Evaluate an expression after temporarily setting malevnc options — with_mcns
code: with_mcns(expr, dataset = getOption("malecns.dataset"))  choose_mcns(dataset = getOption("malecns.dataset"))

title: Evaluate an expression after temporarily setting malevnc options — with_mcns
text: expr expression evaluate default autosegmentation dataset name dataset reported Clio e.g. CNS, VNC etc

title: Evaluate an expression after temporarily setting malevnc options — with_mcns
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ with_mcns(malevnc::manc_dvid_node(type = 'clio')) } # }

title: malecns (development version)
text: add mcns_islatest() move dataset choice malevnc

title: malecns 0.3
text: add mcns_cosine_plot() within dataset connectivity clustering (works nicely across hemispheres) add mcns_body_annotations() get clio annotations (may contain fields neuprint; immediately visible). add mcns_annotate_body() set annotations via clio (now strongly recommended) add mcns_set_dvid_annotations() (already deprecated) export export mcns_ids() add mirror_malecns(), mcns_xyz(), mcns_somapos() add mcns_predict_type() get best guess cell type across type/instance add mcns_predict_type() get best guess cell type across type/instance mcns_dvid_annotations supports option adding extra suffix columns @dokato https://github.com/flyconnectome/malecns/pull/4 Display group connection table results @jefferis https://github.com/flyconnectome/malecns/pull/9 mcns_annotate_body function added @dokato https://github.com/flyconnectome/malecns/pull/13 Fix/dataset clash @jefferis https://github.com/flyconnectome/malecns/pull/14

title: malecns 0.3
text: @dokato made first contribution https://github.com/flyconnectome/malecns/pull/4 Full Changelog: https://github.com/flyconnectome/malecns/compare/v0.2.0…v0.3

title: malecns 0.2.0
text: Add transforms malecns malehb @jefferis #2 fix read_mcns_meshes() static fly meshes add read_mcns_neurons() add mcns_dvid_annotations() mcns_neuprint_meta() fix mcns_connection_table() dev: test infrastructure, pkgdown Full Changelog
